title: BikeRadar’s Tour de France Podcast | Episode 3 – Our favourite Tour de France climbs
content:
The 108th edition of the most famous cycle race in the world, the Tour de France, is well underway, and what a race it’s been so far!

To celebrate one of the world’s biggest sporting spectacles, we’re recording a series of podcasts covering a broad range of Tour related topics.

Our team of road cycling experts have put their heads together to come up with race and tech predictions, analysis of the most impressive tech hidden in plain sight, looked at the route in detail and cast their memories back to some of the key bicycle tech that’s emerged at the Tour in years gone by.

We’ll be updating this list as the Tour progresses, so keep an eye out here or, if you want the podcasts beamed straight to your device of choice, subscribe to the BikeRadar Podcast via Apple or Spotify. Alternatively, just search for us on your preferred podcast provider, so you don’t miss an episode.

BikeRadar’s Tour de France Podcast | Episode 3 – Our favourite Tour de France climbs

The Tour’s climbs often provide the defining moments of the race, with the names of the great climbs etched into every cyclist’s consciousness.

Matthew, Simon and George discuss four of their favourite Tour de France climbs: the iconic Mont Ventoux, Col du Tourmalet, Col du Galibier and Alp d’Huez. And ask what it’s like to ride a giant of the Tour and which climb should be on your bucket list.

BikeRadar’s Tour de France Podcast | Episode 2 – Tour bike tech that changed the face of racing

Senior road technical editor, Warren Rossiter, looks back at some of the most important tech that’s debuted at the Tour over the years.

From bold ideas that were almost instantly banned by the UCI to manufacturing techniques that broke the mold but are now ubiquitous, this is a fascinating deep dive into historical Tour tech.

BikeRadar’s Tour de France Podcast | Episode 1 – Who will win the Tour? And our tech predictions!

In this bumper episode, BikeRadar’s editor-in-chief George Scott is joined by deputy editor Jack Luke and technical writer Simon Bromley to talk all things Tour.

Who will win this year’s race? How is the green jersey competition shaping up? Can Mark Cavendish add to his total of 30 Tour de France stage wins? (Yes). And what does the Tour hold in store for Chris Froome?

Coming up in the series…

During the Tour de France, podcasts will be available twice (or thrice!) a week. In future episodes, we’ll round-up the tech we’ve spotted so far, as well as take a look back at the biggest moments and the funniest bits from the 2021 Tour de France. Look out for our special tech feature on this year’s time trial races, too.

There may be a couple of other sneaky additions to come, but you’ll have to subscribe to make sure you don’t miss those.

If hearing all about the latest in the Tour de France is not your bag, we’ll have plenty of other podcasts for your aural pleasure, from testing the latest aero bikes and taking a look at Shimano’s new Dura Ace groupset (see below) to rounding-up the most interesting tech at Les Gets World Cup this past weekend.
author: BikeRadar
